messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: A hula hoop is a big plastic ring. You spin it around your waist.

The Seven Summits are the seven highest mountains in the world.

Wasfia first saw a hula hoop when she was a young girl.  
She saw a child from another country playing with a hula hoop.  
People in her country thought girls should not play with hula hoops.  
They thought girls should not ride bikes.

Now she has climbed the Seven Summits, like Everest and Kilimanjaro.  
She is the first person to spin hula hoops on each mountain.  
She wants to help women and girls.  
In her country, people do not like girls doing sport.
Feedback received: Grade 2/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text:

- BERTScore 0.8918 is below the threshold of 0.90.

Suggestion: Remove the extra definitions. Reinsert the phrase "native Bangladesh". Align each sentence closely with the original text to restore full meaning and detail.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: Wasfia Nazreen saw a hula hoop when she was a young girl.  
She saw a child from another country playing with the hula hoop.  
The child was visiting Wasfia’s native Bangladesh.  
She did not join.  
People in her country thought girls should not play with hula hoops.  
People in her country thought girls should not ride bikes.  
She is one of the few people to climb the Seven Summits.  
These include Everest and Kilimanjaro.  
She is the first person to hula-hoop on each summit.  
She does this to help women and girls.  
Many people in her country do not like girls to do sport.
Feedback received: Grade 3/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text:

Wasfia Nazreen saw a hula hoop when she was a young girl.  
She saw a child from another country playing with a hula hoop.  
The child came to Bangladesh.  
She did not play with it.  
People in her country thought girls should not play with hula hoops.  
People in her country thought girls should not ride bikes.  
The Seven Summits are seven mountains.  
They are the highest mountain in each part of the world.  
Wasfia is one of the few people to climb the Seven Summits.  
These include Everest and Kilimanjaro.  
She is the first person to hula-hoop on each mountain top.  
She does this to help women and girls.  
Many people in her country do not like girls to do sport.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: A hula hoop is a ring you spin around your middle.  
Wasfia Nazreen was a young girl in her native Bangladesh.  
She saw a hula hoop then.  
She saw a foreign child visiting her country.  
The child was playing with the hula hoop.  
She reluctantly stood by and watched.  
In her country, people thought girls should not play with hula hoops.  
They also thought girls should not ride bikes.  
The Seven Summits are seven mountains.  
They are the highest mountain in each part of the world.  
Wasfia is one of the few people to climb the Seven Summits.  
These include Everest and Kilimanjaro.  
She is the first person to hula-hoop on each mountain top.  
She does this to empower women and girls.
Feedback received: Grade 3/10 - FAIL

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: Wasfia Nazreen was a girl in Bangladesh.  
One day she saw a foreign child use a hula hoop.  
A hula hoop is a toy ring.  
People in Bangladesh said girls must not play with hula hoops.  
They also said girls must not ride bikes.  
Later she climbed the Seven Summits.  
The Seven Summits are the seven highest mountains on each continent.  
Two of them are Everest and Kilimanjaro.  
She is the first person to hula-hoop on each mountain top.  
She does this to empower women and girls in Bangladesh.  
People there say women and girls must not do sport.
Feedback received: Grade 3/10 - FAIL

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: Wasfia Nazreen was a girl in Bangladesh.  
One day, she saw a foreign child playing with a hula hoop.  
She reluctantly stood by and watched.  
A hula hoop is a toy ring.  
In her country, people discouraged girls from using hula hoops.  
They also discouraged girls from riding bikes.  
Later, she climbed the Seven Summits.  
The Seven Summits are the highest mountains on each continent.  
Two of them are Everest and Kilimanjaro.  
She is the first person to hula-hoop on each mountain top.  
Her reason for doing so is to help women and girls there.  
People there discourage women and girls from doing sport.

Suggestion: Restore exact phrases such as "first came across a hula hoop," use "Now Wasfia is one of the few people…" instead of "Later, she climbed…," and keep "empower women and girls" to recover critical lexical content and raise the BERTScore.
